intro: Boechera falcata, commonly known as the Sierra Pointleaf Silene, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Boechera falcata is also noted for its genetic diversity and has been studied for its potential in plant breeding programs.
